Package com.project.alertapp.controllers

Class AlertsController

java.lang.Object
com.project.alertapp.controllers.AlertsController
@RestController @RequestMapping("{userId}/alerts") public class AlertsController extends Object
This class provides REST request for alerts. UserId cannot be null.
Author:
KaanSarigul

  • Constructor Details

    • AlertsController

      public AlertsController()

  • Method Details

    • getAllAlerts

      @GetMapping public List<Alerts> getAllAlerts​(@PathVariable Long userId, @RequestParam Optional<String> stockSymbol)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to get all alerts.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user who the alerts belong to.
      stockSymbol - Not mandatory.If this parameter exists, only alerts of one stock are returned.
      Returns:
      List of alerts that match the criteria.

    • getOneAlert

      @GetMapping("/{alertId}") public Alerts getOneAlert​(@PathVariable Long userId, @PathVariable Long alertId)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to get one alert.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user who the alert belong to.
      alertId - The specified alarm must belong to the user.
      Returns:
      Returns one alert.

    • saveOneAlert

      @PostMapping public Alerts saveOneAlert​(@RequestBody Alerts newAlert)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to save a new alert.
      Parameters:
      newAlert - Alert type object containing alert values.
      Returns:
      Returns saved alert.

    • updateAlert

      @PutMapping("/{alertId}") public Alerts updateAlert​(@PathVariable Long userId, @PathVariable Long alertId, @RequestBody UpdateAlertRequest updateAlertRequest)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to update an alert.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user who the alert belong to.
      alertId - The specified alarm must belong to the user.
      updateAlertRequest - Contains alert specifications, cannot be null.
      Returns:
      Returns updated alert.

    • deleteOneAlert

      @DeleteMapping("/{alertId}/delete") public void deleteOneAlert​(@PathVariable Long userId, @PathVariable Long alertId)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to delete an alert.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user who the alert belong to.
      alertId - The specified alarm must belong to the user.

    • softDeleteAlert

      @PutMapping("/{alertId}/delete") public Alerts softDeleteAlert​(@PathVariable Long userId, @PathVariable Long alertId, @RequestBody SoftDeleteRequest deleteRequest)
      This method sends a request to alertsService to update soft delete situation an alert.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user who the alert belong to.
      alertId - The specified alarm must belong to the user.
      deleteRequest - SoftDeleteRequest object contains soft delete situation for an object.
      Returns:
      Returns updated alert.
